snippet: The meeting was the highest-level contact between the two countries since relations were nearly severed after Iranian students stormed the British Embassy in Tehran in November.
abstract: Foreign ministers of Britain and Iran meet during a security conference in Afghanistan to discuss the conflict in Syria, Iranians living in Britain and the coming talks on Iran's nuclear program; meeting is the highest-level contact between the two countries since relations were nearly severed after Iranian students stormed the British Embassy in Tehran in November 2011.
lead_paragraph: The meeting was the highest-level contact between the two countries since relations were nearly severed after Iranian students stormed the British Embassy in Tehran in November.

headline.seo: Officials From Iran and Britain Discuss Diplomatic Rift
headline.main: British and Iranian Officials Meet to Discuss Rift
headline.print_headline: British and Iranian Officials Meet to Discuss Diplomatic Rift
